name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A coming-of-age story that explores racial injustice, moral growth, and empathy in the American South.
author: Harper Lee

description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian society under constant surveillance and mind control.
author: George Orwell

name: The Great Gatsby
description: A tragic story of love, wealth, and illusion in the Roaring Twenties.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic comedy exploring manners, marriage, and social expectations in 19th-century England.
author: Jane Austen

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy adventure following Bilbo Baggins on a quest filled with dwarves, dragons, and danger.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A story about teenage alienation and rebellion as narrated by Holden Caulfield.
author: J.D. Salinger

name: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: The first volume of The Lord of the Rings, following Frodo as he begins his journey to destroy the One Ring.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: The Hunger Games
description: A dystopian survival story where Katniss Everdeen is forced into a deadly televised arena.
author: Suzanne Collins

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following a young wizard discovering his magical heritage.
author: J.K. Rowling

name: The Fault in Our Stars
description: A romance between two teenagers who meet at a cancer support group.
author: John Green
